definition: to abandon/to relinquish/to discard/to throw away

sentences.english: He was also--He's also disliked, often hated, because of his views.
sentences.chinese: 他还因其观点而遭到唾弃，受到憎恨。

sentences.english: Mr NXP, you'll remain as an idol for me to spit upon.
sentences.chinese: NXP先生，你将永远是我唾弃的偶像。

sentences.english: Jesus was criticized viciously for hanging out with the very people that society detested.
sentences.chinese: 耶稣因为与那些被社会唾弃的人在一起而遭致批评。

sentences.english: A person who betrays his own country will be spurned by people.
sentences.chinese: 一个人背叛自己祖国的人会为世人所唾弃。

sentences.english: The European Union is a monument to Europe's rejection of the old power politics.
sentences.chinese: 欧盟的成立标志着欧洲唾弃了旧时的强权政治。
会发出臭味的垃圾人，“唾弃“名词的源头。

sentences.english: The spurned included the head of Luxembourg's central bank, Yves Mersch.
sentences.chinese: 同样被唾弃的还有卢森堡央行行长威斯默施。

sentences.english: So he spit in contempt on his father's speculating.
sentences.chinese: 因此他轻蔑的唾弃他父亲的投机行为。

sentences.english: It was all because of insincerity if Lakita gave up.
sentences.chinese: 若然我唾弃了什么，必然是因为此人此物的不真诚。

sentences.english: No matter the common people or repelled ones who all can follow Jesus.
sentences.chinese: 不论凡夫俗子或被唾弃者，都能跟从耶稣。

sentences.english: The Yan flew to just query exit, then no from cast off as a meantime, oneself curses.
sentences.chinese: 燕飞刚问出口，便不由唾弃了自己一下，该死的。

sentences.english: The horror of the footage triggered a wave of public condemnation of war crimes.
sentences.chinese: 处刑画面的血腥恐怖重新激起大众对战争罪行的唾弃。

sentences.english: While seeing Bai Cong Ye Lingqing snow, under Bai Cong spit on the snow.
sentences.chinese: 而叶凌青又重新见到白丛雪，却遭到了白丛雪的唾弃。

definition: to spit on and curse/to revile
to despise/to disdain/to look down upon
to condemn in speech and in writing (idiom)/to denounce by word and pen
